summary:
A very important thing to remember: 
MCU Peter Parker is 15-17 years old. He's a minor. Don't ship MCU peter with MCU iron...
body:
A very important thing to remember:

MCU Peter Parker is 15-17 years old. He’s a minor. Don’t ship MCU peter with MCU iron man/deadpool/anyone else in the mcu that isn’t in high school. That’d be pedophilia and that shit’s nasty yo. MCU spiderman/deadpool really doesn’t make much sense since they’ve never even interacted in the MCU.

In the comics, however, Peter is nearly (if not already) 30 years old. Ship him freely, just don’t make it weird/abusive/whatever. Don’t ship him with kids (anyone under 18) either. That’s fuckin gross. Stop being weird.

that’s it bye

summary: Imagine if Peter wasn’t on Titan tho like what if he was hanging out with Ned doing a LEGO set of giant R2D2 or something and...
body: Imagine if Peter wasn’t on Titan tho like what if he was hanging out with Ned doing a LEGO set of giant R2D2 or something and all the sudden Peter starts acting weird saying he doesn’t feel good. Then Ned looks up and his best friend disappears. There’s just a pile of ash on his floor and he doesn’t know what to do. He puts Peter in a bag and takes a bus all the way up to Avengers tower, but when he goes to the door no one answers so he sits there thinking about how he’ll never see Peter again. Eventually after a couple hours Tony shows up visibly hurt, real bad. He looks at Ned who’s obviously been crying for hours, then he looks down at the bag and he just knows.

blog.name: ty-talks-comics
blog.title: Ty Talks Comics
blog.description: A place where I can nerd out about the books I like and rage about the ones I hate!

summary:
Best of this Week: Peter Parker: The Spectacular Spider-Man - Chip Zdarsky and Chris Bachalo
This is the first issue of...
body:
Best of Marvel: August 15th, 2018

Best of this Week: Peter Parker: The Spectacular Spider-Man - Chip Zdarsky and Chris Bachalo

This is the first issue of Spectacular Spider-Man that I’ve opened. Now, I’ve been hearing the praises sung about Chip Zdarsky and this book and I do have all of the issues in a stack somewhere, waiting to be read, but something just drew me to this one. I think it’s because I have a soft spot in my heart for the more down on their luck Spider-Man villains and Sandman has to be one of the more prominent of those.

This issue is particularly heartbreaking because Sandman is losing control of his powers after so many years and is experiencing visions of possibly the future or another life altogether and he doesn’t know what’s going on. Peter, who also seems to have a soft spot for him, visits him as Spider-Man after he’s hospitalized after collapsing into sand. They talk and Spider-Man even suggests the big brains of Marvel that could help Sandman, but he declines and just decides to just let go.

Spider-Man decides to take him to a nice place where Sandman would feel comfortable and the ending might make some cry. Chris Bachalo is definitely the best artist to capture the somber nature of this story with the heavy lines and dark colors that he uses for some sequences and light colors for others. Some may not like his style, but I find it particularly appealing.

Runner Up: Weapon X-Force #22 - Greg Pak, Fred Van Lente, Yildiray Cinar and Frank D'Armata

A NEW ERA BEGINS FOR THIS BADASS LINE-UP OF CHARACTERS. Old Man Logan left Sabretooth in charge of his all new, all different team of mercs and murderers and this book is nothing but dumb fun. Crappy one liners, dick jokes and immaturity all around, Weapon X is the perfect Action Comedy starring what some would argue are the worst versions of Sabretooth, Domino, Lady Deathstrike, Omega Red and Mystique to great effect because they bounce off of each other so well.

There’s not much to say other than I think Dinar is learning a lot from Greg Land or at least has a similar enough visual style that the action is frenetic and pretty. One complain that I have is the use of flat angles way too often. It just amounts to wide angle shots focusing on one or more characters that unfortunately also makes it’s way into action sequences. But hey, still fun!

I’m sure that you have heard,

In the space between two words.”

~ E.H

blog.description:
Hello. My name is Satoshi Mochida. My name comes from a character from the Corpse Party games.
(Sorry, this is not a Role Playing blog.)
I'm a "Tales of" and Higurashi fan. I like other stuff, but those are two main things I like.
I am the moderator of these confession blogs:
http://hellyeahgrowlanserconfessions.tumblr.com/
http://hellyeahsakurawarsconfessions.tumblr.com/
http://nasuverseconfessions.tumblr.com/
Other series I like include:
Harvest Moon
Rune Factory
Pokemon
Digimon
.hack
Super Mario
Sonic the Hedgehog
Final Fantasy
Shin Megami Tensei
Type-Moon related works.
Growlanser
Kingdom Hearts
DJ Max series
Sakura Wars
I'll probably add more later.

Xbox 360: Ani12JB
3DS Friend Code: 0919-9501-9503
I mostly post info and trailers for new or upcoming games from other sites or users., though I'm now reblogging a LOT of fan art now.
